comments:
WorkbenchParts have a method called createPartControl(Composite). The content of
the workbenchpart should be inside the passed in Composite argument. VE needs to
handle various source patterns of createPartControl(Composite) -
1. it is on an abstract super class
2. it on a super class beyond the immediate super
3. it is on this class and on many supers
4. it is empty

Creating this defect so that we track the various possibilities of the
createPartControl(Composite).
It also breaks the JavaBean Laucher

For 1.1 we need to address the following:

2. Black box it.
4. Need to support.

4) Neither me nor Joe was able to recreate the exceptions for opening up an
Empty View. Gili, if you can recreate it, could you please attach the logs so we
can see what the problem is - it might have been a different target setup on
your workspace. Until then I will move this defect to Joe so that he can work on 3).

It is now not possible to drop edit parts if one of the superclasses has
implemented the createPartControl(Composite) method and an error reason is given
in the feedback

For a class like 
------------------
package rCPMail1;
public class MyOtherView extends View {

}
------------------

the following exception is thrown.
